title: Head-on Collision

children.value:
Two masses, X and Y, are moving directly towards one another along a line. The momentum of X before the collision is 
$\quantity{20}{kg\,  m\,  s\sup {-1}}$
 and the momentum of Y before the collision is 
$\quantity{12}{kg\,  m\,  s\sup {-1}}$
. After the collision, the masses move in opposite directions and the momentum of X is 
$\quantity{2}{kg\,  m\,  s\sup {-1}}$
.
What is the magnitude of the momentum of Y?

answer.value:
The correct answer is (c). The total momentum in the direction X is moving in is 
$\quantity{8}{kg\,  m\,  s\sup {-1}}$
 initially, so when X reverses direction and so has a momentum of 
$\quantity{-2}{kg\,  m\,  s\sup {-1}}$
; to make the total equal 
$\quantity{8}{kg\,  m\,  s\sup {-1}}$
 and conserve momentum, the momentum of Y must be 
$\quantity{10}{kg\,  m\,  s\sup {-1}}$
.
